notes: The Zombie attack damage talent is added to the base damage, and not as bonus damage.
The armor talent does not benefit illusions.
Successive casts of Decay fully stack on the targets and on Undying.
Steals strength before applying its damage. Despite the visual effects, the stolen strength is gained instantly.
Despite the visual effects, the stolen strength is gained instantly.

Cannot reduce a hero's strength below 0, but Undying always gains the full amount of strength for each enemy hero affected by Decay. The strength loss on the target does not keep the current health percentage, but instead removes 20 health per strength from the current health pool. The strength gain on Undying does not keep the current health percentage either, and instead adds 20 health per strength to the current health pool. This health bonus does not count as a heal, so it is unaffected by amplifications, and also bypasses Ice Blast and False Promise.

This health bonus does not count as a heal, so it is unaffected by amplifications, and also bypasses Ice Blast and False Promise.

Heroes affected by Decay effectively lose 80 health and 0.4 health regeneration and 4 attack damage if they are a strength hero. Vice versa, Decay effectively increases Undying's health, health regeneration, and attack damage by the same amount per stack. With Aghanim's Scepter, heroes affected by Decay effectively lose 200 health, 1 health regeneration and 10 attack damage they are a strength hero. Upon acquiring or losing Aghanim's Scepter, all stacks of stolen strength instantly update to the current values. Upon updating the strength values, Undying's current health stays the same. However, debuffed enemies keep their current health percentage. Their health also only updates upon gaining or losing maximum health again.
Vice versa, Decay effectively increases Undying's health, health regeneration, and attack damage by the same amount per stack.

However, debuffed enemies keep their current health percentage. Their health also only updates upon gaining or losing maximum health again.

Steal strength from clones, but not illusions. When multiple Meepo Clones are in the area, one of them randomly chosen on each cast gets their strength stolen. The same applies to Arc Warden and his Tempest Double. The damage still hits all clones.
When multiple Meepo Clones are in the area, one of them randomly chosen on each cast gets their strength stolen.
The same applies to Arc Warden and his Tempest Double.
The damage still hits all clones.
Each status buff of Decay increases Undying's model size by 2%. This has no impact on his collision size.
When Undying dies, he loses all the stolen strength, but the affected enemies do not get theirs back, and vice versa.

With Aghanim's Shard, summons an Undying Zombie on each enemy hero that got their strength stolen. This means in case of Meepo Clones and Tempest Double, a zombie spawns only on the clone that got is randomly chosen for the strength steal, and not on all of them. This also means it never spawns zombies on any non-hero unit, or on illusions. The zombies spawned are based on Tombstone's current level. If it is not learned, no zombies spawn.

abilities.description: Undying steals strength from all enemy heroes in an area, dealing base damage as he claims the enemy's strength for himself.
params: Increases Decay radius by 100 and spawns a zombie around each hero target.
Strength loss persists if debuff was placed before spell immunity.
Illusions of Undying or affected enemies do not reflect the gained or lost strength. They keep the original strength values of the heroes.
The strength of the living is simply borrowed from the strength of the dead.
abilities.story: The strength of the living is simply borrowed from the strength of the dead.

notes: ↓↓ Double-tapping automatically targets self.

Can be cast on Tombstone, but not on any other ward type unit. When cast on an allied Tombstone, it always heals it for the given amount, regardless of unit count. Can target enemy Tombstone, but does not damage or heal it.
When cast on an allied Tombstone, it always heals it for the given amount, regardless of unit count.
Can target enemy Tombstone, but does not damage or heal it.
Cannot be cast on Undying Zombie.
The 1300 search radius is centered around Undying, not the target.

Units within the area are selected randomly and have 19/26/33/40 (TagTalent 31/38/45/52) health removed. This health removal is never lethal. Does not count Undying, the target, wards, buildings, invisible enemies and units in the Fog of War. Spell immune allies are counted, including the zombies from Tombstone. Units which require a certain amount of attacks to be killed do not lose health when counted in by Soul Rip. If there are no valid units within the search radius, the damage or healing equals zero.
Does not count Undying, the target, wards, buildings, invisible enemies and units in the Fog of War.
Spell immune allies are counted, including the zombies from Tombstone.
Units which require a certain amount of attacks to be killed do not lose health when counted in by Soul Rip.
If there are no valid units within the search radius, the damage or healing equals zero.

The damage or heal are summed up and the target receives the total value in once instance. Therefore, Soul Rip can damage or heal a unit for up to 152/234/330/440 (TagTalent 248/342/450/572) health. The damage and heal value itself are both still subjected to damage manipulation and heal manipulation.

abilities.description: Undying rips health away from all nearby units and uses it to heal an ally, or damage an enemy. Soul Rip can also be used to heal Tombstone.
params: Can be cast on and counts nearby spell immune allies. Cannot be cast on and does not count nearby spell immune enemies.
Units counted towards damage still lose health.
Even allies feel despair in Undying's presence.
abilities.story: Even allies feel despair in Undying's presence.

notes: Destroys trees within 300 radius around the Tombstone upon cast.
Undying Zombies do not spawn for invisible units or units in the Fog of War.
Zombies do not spawn for wards, buildings, couriers, hidden units and zombies from an enemy Tombstone.
The zombies are uncontrollable and do nothing but attack their set target. However, they can be boosted by allied spells or auras. Howl does not affect the zombies.
Howl does not affect the zombies.
The first wave spawns immediately as the Tombstone is summoned, resulting in 8/9/10/12 possible waves per cast.
When a zombies' target turns invisible, the associated zombies die after 0.1 seconds.
When a zombies' set target dies, the associated zombies die instantly. In the case of Meepo Clones dying, the zombies just stand around until the Tombstone is gone.
In the case of Meepo Clones dying, the zombies just stand around until the Tombstone is gone.
When a zombies' set target runs into the Fog of War, the associated zombies still follow it.
When the Tombstone expires or is killed, all its zombies instantly die.

Illusions and creep-heroes are treated like creeps by the zombies, so they take 2 attacks to destroy it, instead of 1. Therefore, the total amount of attacks required for creeps to destroy the Tombstone are 16/20/24/28 (TagTalent 40/44/48/52) attacks to destroy it, instead of 4/5/6/7 (TagTalent 10/11/12/13).
Therefore, the total amount of attacks required for creeps to destroy the Tombstone are 16/20/24/28 (TagTalent 40/44/48/52) attacks to destroy it, instead of 4/5/6/7 (TagTalent 10/11/12/13).

The Tombstone on death talent spawns 1 Tombstone based on its current level whenever Undying dies, on his death location. Tombstone spawned this way is independent from the cooldown and does not require mana. The Tombstone spawns even when having Reincarnation. The Tombstone lasts its full duration, it is not bound to Undying's death timer and does not disappear when he respawns.
Tombstone spawned this way is independent from the cooldown and does not require mana.
The Tombstone spawns even when having Reincarnation.
The Tombstone lasts its full duration, it is not bound to Undying's death timer and does not disappear when he respawns.
abilities.description: Summons a tombstone at the target point. Zombies will frequently spawn next to every enemy unit in the area around the Tombstone, and attack them. Zombies have the Deathlust ability, which causes their attacks to slow the target, and if the target reaches below a certain amount of health, increases the attack and movement speed of the zombie.
params: Already spawned zombies do not die when their target turns spell immune.
Dirge calls on his fallen brothers to fight for the Dead God.
abilities.story: Dirge calls on his fallen brothers to fight for the Dead God.

notes: Flesh Golem interrupts Undying's channeling abilities upon cast.
Increases Undying's total strength, including strength bonuses. Checks Undying's strength periodically and adapts the bonus instantly.
Checks Undying's strength periodically and adapts the bonus instantly.
Increases Undying's base movement speed to 330.
Multiple attacks on the same target do not stack, but refresh the duration instead.
Amplifies all 3 damage types, including self-inflicted damage and damage dealt by allies.
Flesh Golem is fully canceled on death.
abilities.description: Undying transforms into a horrifying flesh golem. Gains a percentage increase to strength and imbues attacks with a slow and damage amplification.
params: The flesh of the recently dead add to the power of Dirge's plague.
abilities.story: The flesh of the recently dead add to the power of Dirge's plague.

notes: Granted by learning the level 25 talent. This ability is shown as a permanent buff in the HUD.
This ability is shown as a permanent buff in the HUD.
Reincarnation cannot be prevented in any way. If Undying dies with it, it is used.
If Undying has the Aegis of the Immortal, the talent triggers first, if it is off cooldown.
Revives with full health and mana. Abilities and items are not refreshed.
Provides 1800/800 ground vision at his death location during its delay.
The cooldown is not affected by any cooldown reductions.
abilities.description: There is no description for this ability.

notes: The slow from multiple attacks and multiple Undying Zombies fully stack.
Each stack lasts 2.5 seconds. They do not refresh each other's duration.
The number of current stacks can be seen on the debuff icon.

The health of the target is checked in 0.5-second intervals. If their target is below the threshold, the Deathlust Frenzy buff is placed. The buff lasts for 2.5 seconds, but gets refreshed as long as the target stays below the threshold.
The buff lasts for 2.5 seconds, but gets refreshed as long as the target stays below the threshold.
Does not trigger against Familiars.
abilities.description: Slows enemy units on attack. If the attacked unit's health goes below the threshold, the zombie receives enhanced movement and attack speed.

notes: The Tombstone has this ability as well.
The status buff uses the other spell immunity icon.
abilities.description: This creature does not feel the effects of most magical spells.

description: Undying, the Almighty Dirge, is a melee strength hero who serves as a formidable tank and a dangerous spellcaster. His abilities force opponents to either kill him or suffer powerful debuffs in a teamfight. Decay is a spammable ability that steals enemies' Strength in an area, making them more fragile and Undying himself more durable as the fight goes on while also being exceptionally potent during the early laning phase, leaving your opponents with mere scraps of health. Soul Rip can act as both a powerful heal or nuke, redirecting the flow of living energy to a target. By ripping some of the health of his ally or enemy in an area, the target can be healed if an ally, or damaged if an enemy. This is empowered by Tombstone, which acts as a static tank by summoning zombies to slow Undying's foes while active. With the zombies summoned, Soul Rip can perform to its fullest, while Decay weakens Undying's foes. Finally, Undying can transform into a horrific Flesh Golem. This transformation makes him substantially more tanky while allowing his attacks to place a debuff that both slows and amplifies all subsequent damage to the target. Monstrous and truly horrifying, Undying finds great pleasure in keeping himself alive and vital, while his adversaries suffer as he delivers death to the field. With powerful abilities that allow him to perform well in large fights, the Dirge may never cease.
history: How long has it been since he lost his name? The torn ruin of his mind no longer knows. Dimly he recalls armor and banners and grim-faced kin riding at his side. He remembers a battle: pain and fear as pale hands ripped him from his saddle. He remembers terror as they threw him into the yawning pit of the Dead God alongside his brothers, to hear the Dirge and be consumed into nothingness. In the darkness below, time left them. Thought left them. Sanity left them. Hunger, however, did not. They turned on each other with split fingernails and shattered teeth. Then it came: distant at first, a fragile note at the edge of perception, joined by another, then another, inescapable and unending. The chorus grew into a living wall of sound pulsing in his mind until no other thought survived. With the Dirge consuming him, he opened his arms to the Dead God and welcomed his obliteration. Yet destruction was not what he'd been chosen for. The Dead God demanded war. In the belly of the great nothing, he was granted a new purpose: to spread the Dirge across the land, to rally the sleepless dead against the living. He was to become the Undying, the herald of the Dead God, to rise and fall and rise again whenever his body failed him. To trudge on through death unending, that the Dirge might never end.
